['Strand - A single lock or small group of hairs.', 'Tuft - A small bunch or clump of hair, especially at the nape or crown of the head.', "Trim - A short amount of hair that is removed from a person's hairstyle during grooming.", 'Locks - Multiple strands or tufts of hair that are interlocked together.', 'Mane - The mane refers to the long hair growing on horses, but it can also be used informally for human hair at the back and sides of the head.', 'Fringe - Short hair hanging over the forehead; often a style choice in haircuts.', 'Curls - Wavy or curved strands of hair that are naturally formed or styled to form curls.', 'Bangs - Hair cut straight across the forehead, covering part or all of it.', 'Frizzy - Hair that is dry and unruly, often with a tousled appearance due to lack of moisture.', 'Lock - A hairstyle where multiple strands are braided together in an interlocking pattern.', "Topknot - Traditionally, it's the knotted part of hair on top of the head; also used as a hairstyle term for a decorative plaiting atop the head.", 'Locket - A small ornamental case that traditionally held locks or tufts of hair in remembrance of someone who has passed away.', 'Hairpin - An object (usually metal) used to hold hair in place; can also refer metaphorically to a point of tension, as if holding back something important.', 'Cresting - The top part of the head where locks or tufts of hair may gather and form patterns.', 'Locket charm - A small pendant worn on jewelry (such as a necklace) that holds a lock of hair, typically used for sentimental reasons.', 'Chignon - A French term referring to an elegant hairstyle where the hair is twisted and gathered into a knot at the nape of the neck or atop the head.', 'Cuticle - The outer layer of skin covering the base of each hair strand; not directly related but often associated with hair care terminology.', 'Shieldlocks - A type of braided hairstyle where hair is interlocked in a pattern resembling a shield, typically on the back and sides of the head.', 'Knotted hair - Hair that has been styled or twisted together into knots;
